problems.title: No Suction at Floor Head / Hose works fine
problems.description: The vacuum has suction through the hose/wand, but not at the bottom cleaner head.
possible_causes: Clog in the lower duct (COV tube)
solution_steps: Recline the machine fully to engage the floor suction.
Check the 'U-bend' pipe at the back bottom for clogs.
Inspect the changeover valve (the part that switches air from hose to floor) for breakage.

problems.title: Hose Split / Whistling Noise
problems.description: Loud hissing noise and loss of suction. The main stretch hose has a tear.
solution_steps: Inspect the stretch hose, especially near the handle connection.
Duct tape is a temporary fix, but the hose needs replacement.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the suction on a Ball Animal 2 Upright?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement filter or seal typically costs significantly less than a new $483 vacuum, and extending the life of your Dyson is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Ball Animal 2 Upright needs a new filter or seal?
faqs.answer: Common signs include reduced performance and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the filter or seal on my Ball Animal 2 Upright myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
